dataset_id: SAFARI 2000 Airborne Sunphotometer Aerosol Optical Depth and Water Vapor Data
title: SAFARI 2000 Airborne Sunphotometer Aerosol Optical Depth and Water Vapor Data
summary: The NASA Ames Airborne Tracking 14-channel Sunphotometer (AATS-14) was operated successfully aboard the University of Washington CV-580 for 24 data flights during the dry-season airborne campaign from August 13 to September 25, 2000. Flights originated from Pietersburg, South Africa; Kasane, Botswana; and Walvis Bay, Namibia. The AATS-14 instrument measures the transmission of the direct solar beam at 14 discrete wavelengths (350-1558 nm) from which we derived spectral aerosol optical depths (AOD) and columnar water vapor (CWV).
